sen.j: 石川 内命婦（いしかわ の うちみょうぶ、生没年不詳）は、万葉歌人。
sen.e: ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu (date of birth and death unknown) was a Manyo kajin (poets of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)).
ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu (date of birth and death unknown) was a Manyo kajin (poets of Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves)).

sen.j: 大伴安麻呂の妻で、大伴坂上郎女、大伴稲公の母。
sen.e: She was the wife of OTOMO no Yasumaro and the mother of OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume and OTOMO no Inakimi.
She was the wife of OTOMO no Yasumaro and the mother of OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume and OTOMO no Inakimi.
She was a wife of OTOMO no Yasumaro, and the mother of OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume and OTOMO no Inakimi.

sen.j: 石川命婦（いしかわのみょうぶ）とも書く。
sen.e: Her name can also be written as ISHIKAWA no Myobu.
Her name can also be written as ISHIKAWA no Myobu.
Her name can also be written as Ishikawa no Myobu.

sen.j: また『万葉集』には石川郎女という人物もみえており、石川 女郎（いしかわ の いらつめ）大名児（おおなこ）とも書く。
sen.e: There is also a person called ISHIKAWA no Iratsume (石川郎女) in the "Manyoshu," also described as ISHIKAWA no Iratsume (石川女郎) Onako.
There is also a person called ISHIKAWA no Iratsume (石川郎女) in the "Manyoshu," also described as ISHIKAWA no Iratsume (石川女郎) Onako.
There is also a person called Ishikawa no Iratsume (石川郎女) in the "Manyoshu," also described as Ishikawa no Iratsume (石川女郎) Onako.

sen.j: この石川内命婦と郎女が同一人物であるかどうかには議論があり、いまだ定説を得ていない。
sen.e: There is a debate on whether ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu and Iratsume are the same person, and there is no established theory.
There is a debate on whether ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu and Iratsume are the same person, and there is no established theory.
There is a debate on whether Ishikawa no Uchimyobu and Iratsume are the same person, but there is no established theory.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Ishikawa に訂正しました。

sen.j: このうち石川郎女については複数の男性との交際を思わせる歌が残されていることから、橘守部のように「遊行女婦也」（『万葉集檜褄手』）として、遊女とみる理解も古くはあったが、現在では古代豪族の石川氏出身の女性とみる見方が有力である。
sen.e: Among them, ISHIKAWA no Iratsume left poems which suggested she had affairs with multiple men, and some in the old days like TACHIBANA no Moribe wrote 'she was a prostitute' ("万葉集檜褄手"), viewing her as a prostitute, but today, it is widely accepted that she was a woman originally from the Ishikawa clan, an ancient local ruling family.
sen.cmt: 万葉集檜褄手→［正しい読み方が不明です］
sen.e: Among them, ISHIKAWA no Iratsume left poems which suggested she had affairs with multiple men, and some in the old days like TACHIBANA no Moribe wrote 'she was a prostitute' ("万葉集檜褄手"), viewing her as a prostitute, but today, it is widely accepted that she was a woman originally from the Ishikawa clan, an ancient local ruling family.

Among them, Ishikawa no Iratsume left poems which suggested she had affairs with multiple men, and some in the old days like Tachibana no Moribe viewed her as a prostitute by writing as such, but today, it is widely accepted that she was a woman from the Ishikawa clan, an ancient local ruling family.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Ishikawa に訂正しました。Tachibana に訂正しました。

sen.j: 石川氏は蘇我氏の傍系、大和高市郡石川に本拠を有する。
sen.e: The Ishikawa clan was a collateral line of the Soga clan, based in Ishikawa, Takaichi Country, Yamato.
The Ishikawa clan was a collateral line of the Soga clan, based in Ishikawa, Takaichi Country, Yamato.
The Ishikawa clan was a lateral branch of the Soga clan, based in Ishikawa, Takaichi Country, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 大津皇子や草壁皇子と交流があったのも、このふたりが母方で石川氏と関係があったからであろうと思われる（ふたりの母は蘇我倉山田石川麻呂の娘）。
sen.e: She had relationships with Prince Otsu and Prince Kusakabe, but this is believed to be because these two had contact with the Ishikawa clan on the mother's side (their mothers were daughters of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro).

She had relationships with Prince Otsu and Prince Kusakabe, but this is believed to be because these two had contact with the Ishikawa clan on the mother's side (their mothers were daughters of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro).

She had relationships with Prince Otsu and Prince Kusakabe, which was supposedly because these two had contact with the Ishikawa clan on the mother's side (their mothers were daughters of Soganokura-Yamada no Ishikawamaro).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Soganokura-Yamada に訂正しました。

sen.j: おそらく父は蘇我馬子の孫、蘇我倉山田石川麻呂・蘇我赤兄・蘇我連子・蘇我果安のうち誰かであると考えられるが、「郎女」とは貴族の女性の対する敬称であって、誰であるかを特定するのは困難である。
sen.e: The father is believed to be one of the grandchildren of SOGA no Umako, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, SOGA no Akae, SOGA no Murajiko, or SOGA no Hatayasu, but 'Iratsume' is a title for noblewomen, which makes it difficult to specify who.

The father is believed to be one of the grandchildren of SOGA no Umako, SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro, SOGA no Akae, SOGA no Murajiko, or SOGA no Hatayasu, but 'Iratsume' is a title for noblewomen, which makes it difficult to specify who.

Her father is believed to be one of the grandchildren of SOGA no Umako-- Soganokura-Yamada no Ishikawamaro, SOGA no Akae, SOGA no Murajiko, or SOGA no Hatayasu--however, as 'Iratsume' is a title for noblewomen, there is no clue to identify her farther.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Soganokura-Yamada に訂正しました。

sen.e: If this description in the "Manyoshu" was a fact, the caption for the 108th poem states 'Prince Otsu secretly interacted with ISHIKAWA no Iratsume,' and because it states 'secretly,' the relationship was Prince Otsu was adultery.

sen.j: また、久米禅師という不詳の人物との贈答歌が残されているが、これらの歌々は万葉集では天智天皇の時代のものとなっており、大津皇子や草壁皇子とかかわる前の作である。
sen.e: Additionally, there is a Zotoka (poetry exchanged between man and woman) with an unknown person called KUME no Zenji, but these poems are described as from the era of Emperor Tenchi, which means they were written before the relationships with Prince Otsu and Prince Kusakabe.

Additionally, there is a Zotoka (poetry exchanged between man and woman) with an unknown person called KUME no Zenji, but these poems are described as from the era of Emperor Tenchi, which means they were written before the relationships with Prince Otsu and Prince Kusakabe.

sen.j: 天智天皇崩御の際、草壁・大津は10歳前後であり、郎女との年齢差を考えると、このふたりの郎女が同一人物であるかどうかは問題もある。
sen.e: When Emperor Tenchi passed away, Kusakabe and Otsu were around ten years old, and the age difference with Iratsume makes it somewhat difficult to believe these two Iratsume were the same person.
When Emperor Tenchi passed away, Kusakabe and Otsu were around ten years old, and the age difference with Iratsume makes it somewhat difficult to believe these two Iratsume were the same person.

sen.j: しかもこの郎女は大伴田主・大伴宿奈麻呂とも相聞歌をかわしており、これらをすべて実際の恋と結びつけて考えると、きわめて不自然な長さとなる。
sen.e: Furthermore, this Iratsume had romantic exchange of poems with OTOMO no Tanushi and OTOMO no Sukunamaro, and if these were all actual love, the length would be extremely unnatural.

sen.j: このような点からみて、石川郎女というのは「石川氏のお嬢さん」程度の意味で、何人かおなじ名乗りの人物がいたのだろうと考えるのが学会レベルでは一般的である（阿蘇瑞枝など）。
sen.e: Based on these points, at academic meetings (Mizue ASO, etc.), it is often considered that ISHIKAWA no Iratsume simply means 'a young lady from the Ishikawa clan,' and there were several people with the same name.

sen.j: 和銅7年（714年）に安麻呂が死去し、そのあとは大伴家の大刀自（おおとじ。一家の長としての女性）として家を取り仕切ったものと思われる。
sen.e: Yasumaro died in 714, and after that, it is believed that she was in charge of the Otomo family as Otoji (the female head of family).

sen.j: 天平7年（735年）の坂上郎女の歌（『万葉集』巻3-461）の左注に「大家石川命婦依餌藥事往有間温泉」とあり、この時温泉に病気療養に出掛けた記録があり、また天平勝宝5年（753年）に元正天皇の詔にこたえる歌が残されている（『万葉集』巻20－4493）。
sen.e: The caption on the left for the poem of Sakanoue no Iratsume ("Manyoshu" Vol. 3-461) states 'distinguished ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu went to Arima onsen (hot spring) for her health' which notes she went to a hot spring to treat her illness, and in 753, there is a poem responding to an imperial edict by Emperor Gensho ("Manyoshu" Vol. 20-4493).
sen.cmt: 「大家石川命婦依餌藥事往有間温泉」は仮訳です。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The caption on the left for the poem of Sakanoue no Iratsume ("Manyoshu" Vol. 3-461) states 'distinguished ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu went to Arima onsen (hot spring) for her health' which notes she went to a hot spring to treat her illness, and in 753, there is a poem responding to an imperial edict by Emperor Gensho ("Manyoshu" Vol. 20-4493).

The caption on the left for the poem of Sakanoue no Iratsume ("Manyoshu" Vol. 3-461) states 'distinguished Ishikawa no Uchimyobu went to the Arima Hot spring for her health' which notes she went to a hot spring to treat her illness, and a poem responding to an imperial edict by Emperor Gensho in 735 is left ("Manyoshu" Vol. 20-4493).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Sakanoue に訂正しました。Ishikawa に訂正しました。

sen.j: これを同一人物とみてよければ、少なくともこの時までは存命であったと考えられる。

sen.j: つまり、石川郎女・内命婦は天智天皇の時代から、元正天皇の時代まで、おおよそ70年にわたって姿をみせており、これを同一人物とみるのはほとんど不可能ということになる。
sen.e: In short, ISHIKAWA no Iratsume and Uchimyobu appear from Emperor Tenchi to Emperor Gensho's era for about seventy years, and it is almost impossible to see them as the same person.

sen.j: とくに109番歌題詞に「窃に」とあり、この言葉が密通を示す語であること（川口常孝など）から、郎女は草壁の妻妾であり、それと大津が関係をもった、三角関係の歌群であると考えられている。
sen.e: Notably, it is stated 'secretly' in the caption for the 109th poem, and this term indicates adultery (Tsunetaka KAWAGUCHI etc.), it is believed that these were poems of a triangular relationship with Iratsume as a concubine of Kusakabe, and Otsu also becoming involved.

Notably, it is stated 'secretly' in the caption for the 109th poem, and this term indicates adultery (Tsunetaka KAWAGUCHI etc.), it is believed that these were poems of a triangular relationship with Iratsume as a concubine of Kusakabe, and Otsu also becoming involved.

Notably, as the term 'secretly' in the caption for the 109th poem indicates adultery (Tsunetaka KAWAGUCHI etc.), it is believed that these were poems of a love triangular with Iratsume as a concubine of Kusakabe, and Otsu also becoming involved.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 大津皇子、石川郎女に贈る御歌一首
sen.e: A poem for ISHIKAWA no Iratsume by Prince Otsu
A poem for ISHIKAWA no Iratsume by Prince Otsu
A poem for Ishikawa no Iratsume by Prince Otsu

sen.j: あしひきの山のしづくに妹待つと 我立ち濡れぬ山のしづくに 巻2-107
sen.e: Waiting for my love, I stood getting wet with mountain dew. Vol. 2-107
Waiting for my love, I stood getting wet with mountain dew. Vol. 2-107
Waiting for my love, I stood getting wet with mountain dew (Vol. 2-107)

sen.j: 石川女郎、和（こた）へ奉（まつ）る歌
sen.e: Poem by ISHIKAWA no Iratsume in return
Poem by ISHIKAWA no Iratsume in return
Poem by Ishikawa no Iratsume in response
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Ishikawa に訂正しました。

sen.j: 吾を待つと君が濡れけむあしひきの 山のしづくにならましものを 巻2-108
sen.e: The mountain dew that made you wet, how I wish I could be the dew. Vol. 2-108
The mountain dew that made you wet, how I wish I could be the dew. Vol. 2-108
The mountain dew that made you wet, how I wish I could be the dew (Vol. 2-108)
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。()を補足しました。

sen.j: 大津皇子の窃に石川女郎を婚きし時に、津守連通その事を占ひ露はせるに、皇子の御作りたまひし歌。
sen.e: A poem by Prince Otsu when he secretly married ISHIKAWA no Iratsume, and TSUMORI no Muraji Toru revealed it through fortune-telling.
A poem by Prince Otsu when he secretly married ISHIKAWA no Iratsume, and TSUMORI no Muraji Toru revealed it through fortune-telling.
A poem by Prince Otsu when he secretly married ISHIKAWA no Iratsume and TSUMORI no Muraji Toru revealed it through fortune telling.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 大船の津守の占に告らむとは まさしく知りて我が二人寝し 巻2-109
sen.e: I slept with you knowing very well that Tsumori will reveal our relationship with his fortune-telling. Vol. 2-109
I slept with you knowing very well that Tsumori will reveal our relationship with his fortune-telling. Vol. 2-109
I slept with you knowing very well that Tsumori will reveal our relationship with his fortune-telling (Vol. 2-109)

sen.j: 日並皇子尊の、石川女郎に贈り賜ひし御歌一首
sen.e: A poem for ISHIKAWA no Iratsume by Hinamishi no miko no mikoto
A poem for ISHIKAWA no Iratsume by Hinamishi no miko no mikoto
A poem for Ishikawa no Iratsume by Prince Kusakabe

sen.j: 大名児 彼方野辺に刈る草の 束の間も我れ忘れめや 巻2-110
sen.e: Onako, like the small bundle of grass being mowed in a far away field, I cannot forget you even for a very short time. Vol. 2-110
Onako, like the small bundle of grass being mowed in a far away field, I cannot forget you even for a very short time. Vol. 2-110
Onako, like the small bundle of grass being mowed in a far away field, I cannot forget you even for a very short time (Vol. 2-110)
sen.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。()を補足しました。

sen.j: 老境に入り石川内命婦と呼ばれるようになったあと、水主皇女が病を得たとき、元正天皇の命を受けて彼女のために詠んだ歌が以下である。
sen.e: From her later years when she was called ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu, below is a poem she wrote for Minushi no himemiko under the order of Emperor Gensho when she became ill.
From her later years when she was called ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu, below is a poem she wrote for Minushi no himemiko under the order of Emperor Gensho when she became ill.
Below is a poem she wrote, under the order of Emperor Gensho, for Minushi no himemiko, who became ill, during her later years when she was called Ishikawa no Uchimyobu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Ishikawa に訂正しました。

sen.j: 冬の日、靱負の御井に幸（いでまし）し時、内命婦 石川朝臣 諱曰邑婆 詔を応はりて雪を賦（よ）める歌一首
sen.e: A poem about snow that Uchimyobu Ishikawa Ason諱曰邑婆 composed under imperial edict during a visit to Mii of Yukei on a winter day.
sen.cmt: 諱曰邑婆 →［正しい読み方が不明です］
sen.e: A poem about snow that Uchimyobu Ishikawa Ason諱曰邑婆 composed under imperial edict during a visit to Mii of Yukei on a winter day.
A poem about snow that Uchimyobu Ishikawa Ason with personal name '邑婆' composed under imperial edict during a visit to Mii of Yukei on a winter day.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 松が枝の地につくまで降る雪を 見ずてや妹が籠もりをるらむ 巻20-4439
sen.e: The snowing falling so heavily that the branch of the pine tree is touching the ground. My dear woman is secluded in her room unable to enjoy this. Vol.20-4439
The snowing falling so heavily that the branch of the pine tree is touching the ground. My dear woman is secluded in her room unable to enjoy this. Vol.20-4439
The snow is falling so heavily that the branch of the pine tree is touching the ground, My dear woman is secluded in her room unable to enjoy this (Vol. 20-4439)
